description: Construction of a four storey building (including accommodation in a mansard roof) containing 16 self-contained flats with associated car parking, amenity space, landscaping, cycle storage and refuse storage provision; and formation of a vehicle crossover (following demolition of a pair of two residential dwellings)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Location Plan ref. PL-100; Existing Site Plan ref. PL-101; Proposed Ground Floor Plan ref. PL-102, dated Aug 2017, received 07 March 2018; Proposed Ground Floor Plan ref. PL-200, dated Aug 2017, received 07 March 2018; Proposed First Floor Plan ref. PL-201, dated Aug 2017, received 07 March 2018; Proposed Second Floor Plan ref. PL-202, dated Aug 2017, received 07 March 2018; Proposed Third Floor Plan ref. PL-204, dated Aug 2017, received 07 March 2018; Proposed Roof Plan ref. PL-205, dated Aug 2017, received 07 March 2018; Proposed Side Elevation ref. PL-400, dated August 2017, received 07 March 2018; Proposed Rear Elevation ref. PL-401, dated Aug 2017, received 07 March 2018; Proposed Front Elevation ref. PL-402, dated Aug 2017, received 07 March 2018; Proposed Side Elevation ref. PL-403, dated Aug 2017, received 07 March 2018; Proposed Street Elevation ref. PL-404, dated Aug 2017, received 16 January 2018.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| The refuse and recycling storage facilities hereby approved shall be kept locked, and implemented and operational before the first occupation of any part of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).

| The vehicle parking arrangements shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. At least two of these parking spaces shall provide active charging points for electric vehicle.  These electric vehicle charging points shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the approved development.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site and in the interest of the environment and improving air quality in accordance with policies 6.3, 6.13 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016; policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Sheltered and secure cycle parking for at least 22 cycles shall be in place prior to first occupation of the development and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(k) and (g) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG.
| No planting or fencing shall be provided exceeding a height of 0.6m high within the pedestrian visibility splays (measuring 1.5m x 1.5m).
Reason:  In the interest of public safety, in accordance with policies 6.3 of the London Plan (2016); and policy 1.1(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012).
| Sustainable Design and Construction Standards
A.	Prior to commencement of the development, other than site preparation, remediation and / or the formation of accesses, details should be provided to demonstrate the following:
a.	how waste will be dealt through the construction stage.
b.	registration with Considerate Constructor Scheme aiming to meet beyond best practice standards.
c.	the acoustic insulation applied to this scheme
d.	implementation of insulation materials with Ozone Depletion Potential of 0 and GWP of less than 5.

B.	Upon the first occupation of the development, the approved development shall incorporate sustainability measures as detailed in the approved Sustainability Statement (February 2018) prepared by JSA Energy.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012.
| Overheating & Cooling

Prior to commencement of the development, other than site preparation, remediation and / or the formation of accesses, the details of the dynamic thermal modelling, using the guidance provided in CIBSE TM59 & TM49 (DSY01, DSY02, DSY03) and demonstrating how the development performs against and even exceed the overheating criteria, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The details of any additional measures to be incorporated into the development to minimise the risk of overheating (without active cooling) shall also be submitted if the dynamic thermal modelling demonstrates that overheating would occur. Compliance with Building Regulations Criterion 3 should be also demonstrated. The development shall thereafter be provided in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with policy 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).
| Overheating & Cooling

Prior to commencement of the development, other than site preparation, remediation and / or the formation of accesses, the details of the dynamic thermal modelling, using the guidance provided in CIBSE TM59 & TM49 (DSY01, DSY02, DSY03) and demonstrating how the development performs against and even exceed the overheating criteria, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The details of any additional measures to be incorporated into the development to minimise the risk of overheating (without active cooling) shall also be submitted if the dynamic thermal modelling demonstrates that overheating would occur. Compliance with Building Regulations Criterion 3 should be also demonstrated. The development shall thereafter be provided in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with policy 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).
| 10	Energy Strategy

A)	Prior to commencement of the development, other than site preparation, remediation and / or the formation of accesses, evidence and appropriate plans from a structural engineer that the timber frame structure will be designed to carry the weight of the PV panels, their mounting structure and green/brown roof should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

B)	Within three-months of the practical completion of the dwellings, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports showing clearly the DER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

C)	Within three-months of the practical completion of the dwellings, evidence that the renewable/low carbon technology (ies) is certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria shall be submitted.

D)	Prior to the final completion of the development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate and maintain measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 35.33% (equal to 6.136 tonnesCO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Strategy February 2018 prepared by JSA Energy:

a)	energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 0.693 tonnes CO2/yr equating to 4% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.

b)	Installation of at least 12.62kW solar PV to produce 10.49MWh/year of electricity and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 5.443 tonnes CO2 per year, equating to at least 32.65% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Lean case of the Energy Hierarchy.

D) Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be identified and incorporated prior to occupation and maintained in the development in perpetuity.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Ultra Low NOx Gas boilers dry NOx emission

Prior to the first use of the development, the approved development shall incorporate and maintain, Ultra low-NOx boilers gas boiler(s) for the provision of the space heating and hot water requirements with dry NOx Emissions below 40 mg/kWh in line with the Sustainable Design and Construction SPG (April 2014).

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, April 2014.
| Water Efficiency

Prior to occupation of each residential unit within the development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate and maintain water saving measures that will meet water efficiency standards with a maximum water use target of 105 litres of water per person per day.
Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with the approved sustainability statement and policy 5.15 of the London Plan 2016.
| A suitable scheme of proposed tree planting and pits shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first use of the development hereby approved.

No operations shall commence on site in connection with the development hereby approved until a suitable scheme of proposed tree planting and tree pits have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The scheme shall include the following comprehensive details of all trees to be planted:
o	Full planting specification - tree size, species, the numbers of trees and any changes 	from the original application proposals.
o	Locations of all proposed species.
o	Comprehensive details of ground/tree pit preparation to include:
o	Plans detailing adequate soil volume provision to allow the tree to grow to maturity
o	Engineering solutions to demonstrate the tree will not interfere with structures (e.g. root barriers/deflectors) in the future
o	Staking/tying method(s).
o	Five year post planting maintenance and inspection schedule.

All tree planting must be carried out in full accordance with the approved scheme in the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive). The quality of all approved tree planting should be carried out to the levels detailed in British Standard 8545, Trees: from nursery to independence in the landscape - Recommendations.

Any trees which die, are removed, uprooted, significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed within five years from the completion of planting, must be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with a tree/s of the same size, species and quality as previously approved.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.21 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment shall be submitted to the Council for approval of external noise levels from traffic, industrial/commercial and community sources and details of the sound insulation of the building envelope and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation to achieve internal room- and (if provided) external amenity noise standards in accordance with the criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise from transport [industrial/ commercial/ community noise sources], in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of an enhanced sound insulation value D nT,w [and L' nT,w ] of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely living room and kitchen above/ below bedroom of separate dwellings and bedrooms adjacent to entrance hall and stairs. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a construction management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. Details shall include control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 hrs on Saturdays, advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works and public display of contact details including accessible phone contact to persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works. Approved details shall be implemented throughout the project period.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 3.1 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), and policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to first occupation, for the installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh.  The works, as approved, shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation from the rear to habitable rooms. The approved mitigation scheme shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to first occupation of each dwelling and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration
